term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - principal ion in mass spectrometry
term.title: principal ion

item.text: A molecular or fragment ion which is made up of the most abundant isotopes of each of its atomic constituents. In the case of compounds that have been artifically isotopically enriched in one or more positions such as CH313CH3 or CH2D2 the principal ion may be defined by treating the heavy isotopes as new atomic species. Thus, in the above two examples, the principal ions would be of masses 31 and 18, respectively.
